meanings.definition: To formulate a new theory or set of theories.
meanings.sent1: After reading new research, she decided to retheorize her ideas.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often retheorize when they discover new evidence that challenges their current theories.
meanings.sent3: The professor had to retheorize his lecture after realizing he had mixed up his notes.
meanings.sent4: Just like a painter rethinks their color choices, a scientist may retheorize their hypotheses.
meanings.sent5: In order to stay relevant, researchers must constantly retheorize and adapt their theories.

meanings.definition: To reconsider or revise a theory.
meanings.sent1: When the experiment failed, they had to retheorize their approach.
meanings.sent2: It is important for scholars to retheorize their ideas based on new information.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to retheorize the crime scene after finding a new clue.
meanings.sent4: Just as a writer may rework their story, a scientist may retheorize their explanations.
meanings.sent5: To improve their understanding, students should regularly retheorize concepts they struggle to grasp.
